channel.title: Websocket Support in Oldes Rebol3
channel.description:
Looking to see what Oldes has been up to, he added some kind of minimal websocket support to the HTTP scheme:
https://github.com/Oldes/Rebol3/commit/bae6cffe97e662ec9a727a01cdcc1fdd61455ea6#diff-490ba807ac4a5ee57e7a587ca0936d36e4c0ff2798b0652fdf791e758ce079c2R718
Websockets isn't something I'm looking into at this time, but I wanted to bookmark it here in case it comes up later.
He also updated zlib to a new version released in 2022... and [used Ren-C's %make-zlib.r to do it!](https://github.com/Oldes/Rebol3/commit/15fcc00b84f6d0e386f2ba2f4fc7bdc32ebff75d). But he edited it so he'd be able to run it under his Rebol3. It's not a huge priority to do that update, but seems like since his ported script still worked, it might not be too hard. (And a good reminder that script exists, and should be part of a CI test...)
